<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16370](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16370.html) (depends: cleanup package configure flags by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

<!--a722867cd34abeea1fadc8d60700f111-->

Fantastic! :relaxed: Could you add a comment detailing our rationale and include a link to the qt requirements page?
@dongcarl rebased and added a comment and Qt link to the commit body and `.mk` file.

tACK 3303124960d3d857d9ce29a88a589e00b1d0f8fa

Performed Guix build of 3303124960d3d857d9ce29a88a589e00b1d0f8fa (`fanquake/disable_xcb_extensions`) and fbe4b7665b971aec3cf7448309d59d2661e513bd (`git merge-base fanquake/disable_xcb_extensions origin/master`), found `sha256sum distsrc-*/installed/bitcoin-0.18.99/bin/bitcoin{d,-qt}*` to be identical.
How can they be identical when the git commit id is embedded into the binary? I guess guix does not embed it?

@MarcoFalke is https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/00dad5e0e1ddd6047bd4ff0a3032aa8950817b5f/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L156 what embeds it? I didn't know if this line was needed anymore so I removed it from the guix build script.

>  what embeds it? I didn't know if this line was needed anymore so I removed it from the guix build script.

Good question. I don't really know. Also, it seems that for releases (i.e. our git tags), the commit id is not included.
Is the discussion about identical binaries a blocker for merging this? (I don't think so but ask just in case)

> Is the discussion about identical binaries a blocker for merging this? (I don't think so but ask just in case)

Nope, not at all. :relaxed: For reference, further discussion on this topic should probably now happen here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16588
